p: Although the pathophysiology of SARS-CoV-2 is not fully understood, it seems most likely similar to the one of SARS-CoV-1. Substantial evidence suggests that SARS-CoV-2 infection could initiate an aggressive inflammation by increasing cytokines secretion such as interleukin-1 β (IL-1 β), interferon- γ (IFN- γ), tumor necrosis factor- α (TNF- α), interleukin-2 (IL-2), interleukin-4 (IL-4), and interleukin-10 (IL-10), their plasma levels being associated with disease severity, leading to a so-called “ cytokine storm,” thus explaining some young adults' disease severity [ 29].
